title: Chin Tuck
tipsToRemember: Don't force the motion. Aim for 70-80% of your full range of motion.
Avoid tilting your head back or down excessively.

title: Cervical Rotation Stretch
tipsToRemember: Imagine that you have a broomstick strapped to your back.
Maintain gaze on your belly button.
Keep your chin as close to the chest as possible.

title: Side Flexion Stretch
tipsToRemember: Imagine that you have a broomstick strapped to your back.
Relax your neck as you move your head from side to side.
Take deep breaths to keep your shoulders relaxed

title: Standing Neck Rotation Stretch
tipsToRemember: Imagine that you have a broomstick strapped to your back.
Try to look over your shoulder when turning your head.

title: Neck Side Flexion Stretch
tipsToRemember: Imagine that you have a broomstick strapped to your back.
Relax your neck as you move your head to the side.
Take deep breaths to keep your shoulders relaxed.

title: Active Neck Flexion/Extension Stretch
tipsToRemember: Imagine that you have a broomstick strapped to your back.
Look up into the sky and then down at your feet.
Take deep breaths to keep your shoulders relaxed.

title: Active Neck Lateral Flexion Stretch
tipsToRemember: Imagine that you have a broomstick strapped to your back.
Relax your neck as you move your head to the side.
Take deep breaths to keep your shoulders relaxed.

title: Active Neck Rotation Stretch
tipsToRemember: Imagine that you have a broomstick strapped to your back.
Try to look over your shoulder when turning your head.

title: Seated Clasp Neck Stretch
tipsToRemember: Take deep breaths to keep relaxed
Don't pull, let the weight of your arms guide the stretch.

title: Levator Scapulae Stretch
tipsToRemember: Take deep breaths to keep your neck relaxed.
Donâ€™t pull, let the weight of your arms guide the stretch.

title: Half Circles
tipsToRemember: Relax your neck as you move your head to the side.
Take deep breaths to keep your shoulders relaxed.

title: Pectoralis Stretch
tipsToRemember: Imagine that you have a broomstick strapped to your back.
Maintain your upright posture while stepping forward with one foot.

title: Above Head Chest Stretch
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Try to crack an imaginary walnut between your shoulder blades.

title: Behind Back Chest Stretch
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Try to crack an imaginary walnut between your shoulder blades.

title: Wall Angels
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Exhale while straightening your arms and relax your shoulder blades.

title: Shoulder Rolls
tipsToRemember: Try to crack an imaginary walnut between your shoulder blades when rolling your shoulders back.
Relax your shoulder blades when rolling your shoulders forward.

title: Crossover Arm Stretch
tipsToRemember: Don't hitch your shoulder up during the stretch.
Keep your upright posture throughout the stretch.

title: Scapular Squeezes
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Try to crack an imaginary walnut between your shoulder blades.

title: Front Wall Walks
tipsToRemember: Keep your shoulder relaxed throughout the exercise.
Don't climb further than you can move without hitching your shoulder upwards.

title: Side Wall Walks
tipsToRemember: Keep your shoulder relaxed throughout the exercise.
Don't climb further than you can move without hitching your shoulder upwards.

title: Shoulder Rotation
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Keep your shoulders relaxed throughout the exercise.

title: Towel Slide Flexion/Extension
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Use your uninjured arm to help push the shoulder forward till you feel the stretch.

title: Towel Slide Add/Abd
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Keep your shoulders relaxed throughout the exercise.
Use your uninjured arm to help push the shoulder outward till you feel the stretch.

title: Towel Slide Int/Ext Rotation
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Keep your elbow locked to your ribcage
Look straight ahead to keep your torso straight.

title: Shoulder Shrugs
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
To control the downward movement, exhale while letting the shoulders relax.

title: Towel Slide Circles
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Use your uninjured arm to help push your hand in circles.

title: Stick External Rotation
tipsToRemember: Keep your elbows locked to your ribcage.
Use the unaffected arm to move the stick and affected arm outward.

title: Behind-the-Neck Pass
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Maintain your gaze straight ahead.
Squeeze an imaginary walnut between your shoulder blades.

title: Behind-the-Waist Pass
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Maintain your gaze straight ahead.
Squeeze an imaginary walnut between your shoulder blades.

title: Active Shoulder Flexion
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Focus on keeping your thumb pointing upward.

title: Active Shoulder Abduction
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Focus on keeping your palm facing forward and thumb pointing upward.

title: Isometric Shoulder Flexion
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Keep your back straight during the exercise.

title: Isometric Shoulder Extension
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Keep your back straight during the exercise.
Push only with your elbow.

title: Pendulum Flexion/Extension
tipsToRemember: Take deep breaths to keep your shoulders relaxed.
Use your body to move yourself forward and backward.

title: Pendulum Adduction/Abduction
tipsToRemember: Take deep breaths to keep your shoulders relaxed.
Use your body to move yourself from side to side.

title: Pendulum Circumduction
tipsToRemember: Take deep breaths to keep your shoulders relaxed.
Use your body to move yourself in a circular motion.

title: Pencil Pushout
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Maintain your gaze straight ahead.

title: Forearm Extensor Stretch
tipsToRemember: Keep the arms straight, but do not lock the elbows.
Learn on the table for support if needed.

title: Forearm Flexor Stretch
tipsToRemember: Keep the arms straight, but do not lock the elbows.
Learn on the table for support if needed.

title: Prayer Stretch
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Make sure that your palms stay together during the stretch and keep your shoulders relaxed.

title: Reverse Prayer Stretch
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Stop if you feel pain or tingling along the inside of the wrist.

title: Fist Flexion
tipsToRemember: Be gentle and avoid squeezing your hand too tightly.

title: Claw Stretch
tipsToRemember: Be gentle and avoid squeezing your hand too tightly.

title: Finger Walking Adduction
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Keep the wrist still, focusing on moving only one finger at a time.

title: Finger Walking Abduction
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Keep the wrist still, focusing on moving only one finger at a time.

title: Wall Press
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Maintain your gaze straight ahead.

title: Bicep Curls
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Keep your elbows locked to the side of your body.
To control the downward movement, exhale while letting the shoulders relax.

title: Supine Arm Lengthening
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Keep your hands straight above your chest.
Extend your arms without lifting your shoulders.

title: Supine Arm Abduction
tipsToRemember: Relax the shoulders and push only with your elbows.
Take deep breaths to keep your shoulders relaxed.

title: Standing Arm Lengthening
tipsToRemember: Keep your arm straight, but do not lock the elbows.
Use your uninjured arm to help you keep the straight position.

title: Seated Passive Arm Lengthening
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Take deep breaths to keep your shoulder and arm relaxed, allowing the helper to move your arm.

title: Assisted Arm Lengthening
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Keep your arm straight, but do not lock the elbows.

title: Stick Lean
tipsToRemember: Keep your arm straight, but do not lock the elbows.
Use your uninjured arm to help you stretch out the affected arm.

title: Stick Abduction
tipsToRemember: Keep your arm straight, but do not lock the elbows.
Use your uninjured arm to help you stretch out the affected arm.

title: Bottle Straight Push
tipsToRemember: Keep your arm straight, but do not lock the elbows.
Use your uninjured arm to help you stretch out the affected arm.

title: Bottle Circles
tipsToRemember: Keep your arm straight, but do not lock the elbows.
Use your uninjured arm to help you move the affected arm.

title: Bottle Straight Punch
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Keep your arm on the surface of the table.

title: Bottle Pushing
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Relax the shoulders and push only with your elbows.
Keep your arm on the surface of the table.

title: Supine Active Shoulder Flexion
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Limit the amount of side to side shoulder movement.

title: Supine Active Elbow Flexion
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Keep your elbow above your chest.
Limit the amount of side to side shoulder movement.

title: Functional Cup Placing
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
When you feel comfortable, use cups of different sizes and weight.

title: Functional Cup Pouring
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
When you feel comfortable, use cups of different sizes and weight.

title: Functional Ball Rolling
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
When you feel comfortable, use a smaller ball, or place your hands further apart.

title: Functional Ball Drop and Catch
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
When you feel comfortable, try switching your hands so that the more affected arm is dropping the ball.

title: Functional Drying Off
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Maintain your gaze straight ahead.
Squeeze an imaginary walnut between your shoulder blades.

title: Shoulder Press
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Maintain your gaze straight ahead.
Pull your abdominals to maintain balance.

title: Triceps Towel Stretch
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Maintain your gaze straight ahead.
Make sure the towel stays along the length of your spine.

title: Overhead Triceps Stretch
tipsToRemember: Push your chest out and pull your shoulders back.
Maintain your gaze straight ahead.
Squeeze an imaginary walnut between your shoulder blades.

title: Unweighted Pronation/Supination
tipsToRemember: Don't swing the arm. Try to keep the same level of force throughout the movement.

title: Wrist Flexion/Extension
tipsToRemember: Make sure to hold the elbow still and only move the forearm.
Don't swing the arm. Try to keep the same level of force throughout the movement.

title: Wrist Adduction/Abduction
tipsToRemember: Make sure to hold the elbow still and only move the forearm.
Don't swing the arm. Try to keep the same level of force throughout the movement.

title: Functional Paper Crumpling
tipsToRemember: To make this task easier, crumple a hand towel.
To make this task harder, you can tear the paper into strips.

title: Functional Counting Coins
tipsToRemember: Make sure to not lift your elbow and shoulder while stacking the coins.
When you feel comfortable, increase the number of coins to be counted, and your speed.

title: Functional Drawing and Cutting
tipsToRemember: When you feel comfortable, draw more complicated shapes.
Draw shapes onto different thicknesses of paper.

title: Functional Spreading Cards
tipsToRemember: Be sure to use your entire upper body to spread the cards
When you feel comfortable, increase the number of cards to be spread, and your speed.

title: Functional Sorting Cards
tipsToRemember: If you are able, shuffle the cards
When you feel comfortable, increase the number of cards to be sorted, and your speed.

title: Functional Dealing Cards
tipsToRemember: If you are able, shuffle the cards
When you feel comfortable, increase the number of cards to be dealt, and your speed.

title: Functional Pencil Shuffle
tipsToRemember: When you feel comfortable, increase your speed whilst maintaining your accuracy.

title: Functional Pencil Roll
tipsToRemember: When you feel comfortable, increase your speed whilst maintaining your accuracy.

title: Functional Pencil Twirl
tipsToRemember: When you feel comfortable, increase your speed whilst maintaining your accuracy.

title: Functional Placing Pegs
tipsToRemember: Place your unaffected hand on the table for stability.
When you feel comfortable, use a cup to increase difficulty.

title: Functional Pick Up Sticks
tipsToRemember: Place your unaffected hand on the table for stability.
When you feel comfortable, use a cup to increase difficulty.

title: Functional Turning Coins
tipsToRemember: Try not to flip the coins over by slide over the edge of the table.
When you feel comfortable, increase your speed whilst maintaining your accuracy.

title: Finger O's
tipsToRemember: Focus on accuracy rather than speed.

title: Finger Bends
tipsToRemember: Focus on accuracy rather than speed.

title: Ball Squeeze
tipsToRemember: Try to keep the same level of force throughout the movement.

title: Thumb Bend
tipsToRemember: Focus on accuracy rather than speed.

title: Ball Pinch
tipsToRemember: Try to keep the same level of force throughout the movement.

title: Weighted Pronation/Supination
tipsToRemember: Don't swing the dumbbell. Avoid rapid or jerking movements.
